comment: This was a tough class for me. I am not very good at test taking, but I did fail almost every test and still passed with an A. Our student teacher was my lifesaver when I was struggling badly. Sabrina was awesome, and the tutoring was so very helpful! I would recommend this class for anyone.
Really great teacher I put lots of homework but every class is going to be around the same amount for college algebra so...

Professor McAleer is great! She explains topics in extreme detail and make sure everyone understands before moving on. There only 8 quizzes, 2 tests, 6 problem write ups, and 7 khan academy units. She does take attendance and it counts for your grade but she is understanding if you miss class. She is very kind and loves what she does.
She is an understanding professor and always willing to help before and after class. If you read the textbook, do the homework, you will do great in this class.
rating_tags: Amazing lectures --Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback

comment: failed 8 people in our class. She also sent an email out with the names of the eight people who failed so everyone knows my business. I went to every review session and did all of the extra credit. Made an A on the last quiz but she won't even show me my final grade just says I need to retake the class. Do not take her.

ive always struggled with math but dr. mcaleer was so clear in her lectures and would always answered any questions you had until you understood. would walk around to each student to make sure they were not struggling. 2 exams, 1 final, 1 quiz every two weeks-ish, and a few problem write ups. exams are exactly like her study guides. take her!!!
rating_tags: Amazing lectures --Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback

comment: Dr. McAleer is a great professor and she cares about her students. Make sure to show up to class and study for quizzes. She can be a bit of a picky grader, but overall the class is not hard. She is always willing to help her students understand a topic better.

LOVE professor McAleer! She genuinely cares to teach and helps students understand. This class is insanely easy, but explaining how you answer problems is everything in this class. Just complete your work on time, go to class, and pay attention and you will get an A. Shes amazing so defintiely take her if you can!!
Amazing. Highly recommend. I'm an elementary school education major and this class was super fun. I love math so that might have a little bias in it, but overall, great!

she is super nice that if you do the study guide, she will put 5 points towards your test. 4 test and One final exam. She is so nice and very accomidating. In fact, if you tell her if you miss class (With excuse NO SKIPPING) she will give you her notes to catch up.
Made sure to help students in the event they didn't understand something. Would slow class down if someone needed it. Make sure you read the textbook though because that was my downfall.

I really enjoyed Professor McAleer and her class. She is a very kind teacher who wants the best for her students. She is really good about checking for understanding and making sure everyone understands the concepts. Overall really nice professor who made the class very easy. :) Recommend!

Take this professor because not only she caring but she one of the best, patient, and nice professor I ever have. She gives out study guides for every exam(especially final) that is similar to it. But the thing is that she helps if students are failing but you have
awesome professor!! really kind and lectures were helpful and easy to learn :) not a heavy work load at all, i really enjoyed her class

Professor McAleer is so sweet and caring. She truly wants her student's to succeed, and as long as you pay attention and reach out for help when you need it, you will. I struggle with algebra a lot and I needed a lot of extra help to keep up, but she suggests resources for students to get assistance.

SHE IS THE BEST PROFESSOR I EVER HAVE. Not only that give Notecards FOR EVERY TESTS, but she even give out extra credit by doing the study guides. When comes to near test days, she give out online meeting sessions or after class sessions If you need help on a topic. She is so nice, caring, and patient for every student. TAKE THIS PROFESSOR!

Her study guides are accurate to the test and always reminds the class that there is tutoring sessions outside of class if you need her or someone else for help. She also gives other assignments in order to boost your grade if you do struggle. Must finish the homework to be prepared for weekly quizzes (Your expected to finish the HW either way)

Do not be intimidated by the level of difficulty. I would honestly take her again. Attendance matters but it is not too bad since the class time is very short. I am a math person so i enjoyed her class but tutors can be useful. Her class is doable.
Dr. McAleer is an amazing teacher but she does take off for attendance no matter what and is a tough grader.

I would take Professor McAleer again. She is very caring for her students. Be prepared to spend a lot of time for this class since there is a lot of information that you have to learn in a small amount of time. I do recommend getting a tutor for this especially if you are not the best at math.

Professor McAleer is incredible! She wants everyone to succeed. I have struggled with math since I was very young and she gave me so much assistance to pass this class. She takes the time to work and help her students understand and truly learn the content.

I would take this professor again. She cares if you understand the material you are learning in class. She tells you what is on the test and quizzes and what she expects from you. She makes you think about being the teacher and the student and the different ways that the student can think.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Clear grading criteria--Accessible outside class

comment: Just do your homework and come to class. Take advantage of the study guides

She is super caring and wants everyone to succeed. She will stay after class and help you with anything you need. As long as you go to the class you will pass. The homework can take a while but she prepares you for it so you will pass. Definitely recommend to anyone who wants to take math 1111.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Clear grading criteria--Lots of homework

comment: LOVE her class! Go to class, pay attention, do the readings & assignments & you will do fine. Easy work -remember to not overthink & write your stuff in a way that you can look back at it when you are in your own classroom for reference for yourself. 2 exams, a couple of hw assignments & a couple of quizzes. Work in groups the whole time in class.

Dr. McAleer was excellent! There is a lot of homework, however, if you put in the work, you will get a good grade, and I'm not a math person. I reached out for help multiple times and always got a response and good assistance. Lenient grader too. I also have accommodations and she was definitely understanding and willing to help.

There is a lot of work that goes into this class. I highly recommend that you get a tutor for this class because there is a lot of information for this class and a lot of concepts to go over as well. She also marks off the little things that you forget to put on your homework and tests.

Shes my favorite math professor, she explains the concepts very well and is very patient. She wants the best for her students and is easy to talk to. Attendance is mandatory so do not miss class, as long as you pay attention and do your part you will be successful!

She is the best College algebra professor. She teaches very well and was also very nice. She ensured her students understood the content. She has office hours and a SI (in my specific class she did) after. Definitely going to miss her

I love Professor McAleer. She has been one of my favorite professors. She takes her time explaining topics and explains them different ways that are easy to understand. If youre used to more advanced math you might get bored of the class but its also a good review course. Class is mandatory you get multiple participations grades.
Class is definitely mandatory, if you miss one day you're going to be behind guaranteed. Lot of homework on aleks. it is what it is

I normally SUCK at math like actually am awful at it BUT professor McAleer made it tolerable for me. She uses ALEKS which is a LOT of homework but it really does help you learn the material and practice it. Still hate math but she was the best math professor I could've taken and she wants her students to succeed.
rating_tags: Respected--Skip class? You won't pass.--Clear grading criteria

comment: Professor McAleer is a really good professor I would 100% take her again!!! She make math easy to understand she really cares about her students where she would review problems that students would have trouble in. Pls do her study guide it will help you prepare for the test. The only bad thing is there is a lot of hw but thats all math111 class :/

Loved this professor and this course. She made sure everyone understood before moving on and asked us questions so we all understood. Lots of partner or group working with hands-on activity. I wish I could take this course again! The group work and actual class participation helped me learn even better. If you have the chance, take this professor!

She grades attendance so make sure you attend class but she drops two at the end of the semester. do not buy the book, save your money. Deanna grades very hard so make sure you know what is going on during class. you are graded on your participation/attendance, midterm, 4 quizzes, 9 homework, & final. You almost always work in groups.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.--Tough grader

comment: I am usually not a math person, but I LOVED this course. Dr. McAleer is such an amazing teacher and truly makes math enjoyable. Although the content was easy as you're learning about elementary math, it was still fun and challenging. She is so great at explaining, provides extra credit, and is always there to help. TAKE HER! (don't skip tho!)
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Skip class? You won't pass.--Caring

comment: McAleer really cares about her student's success. She is a tough grader but it is for a good reason. The quizzes can be tough but if you show up to class and really participate you should pass. I really enjoyed this class because we got to work with groups a lot and that really helps. She is super kind and always willing to help with questions.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: She is a wonderful professor! She explains everything well and genuinely cares about you and your grade. Id highly recommend her!

She is very sweet, but she is a tough grader. You definitely need to show up to class if you want to pass. Attendance is mandatory and is a part of your grade. Quizzes are during class as well as exams. The textbook is needed because she pulls out questions and puts them on the quiz!
rating_tags: Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.--Clear grading criteria

comment: Professor McAleer was a gem! She was consistent, caring, and I always felt supported in the class. You are expected to read in the textbook each week, but its not lengthy and it is very helpful. Shes an excellent teacher and I feel confident in my abilities.

I loved Mrs. McAleer. She grades extremely tough though, and 100% expects you to make it to every class. She is very sweet but make sure you study and dont forget to show all work on tests and quizzes as best as you can. She takes off for silly things. Overall, loved her though.

Professor McAleer is awesome. Took Algebra with her and she was a great choice. Lots of homework as to be expected of a math course, but she is very easily approachable which was important for me in a math course. She is glad to explain something again and is very easy to communicate with. I would recommend her for sure
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Accessible outside class--Clear grading criteria

comment: Im not crazy about math, but Dr. McAleer made this class so enjoyable & easy. I took this class as a hybrid. She really cares about her students and she provides different ways to learn the material. She also stays after class to help students. Shes a great professor and Ive recommended her to all of my friends!
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Clear grading criteria--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: Love this professor. I've learned so much in this class, it's probably my favorite class that I've taken in the EDUC program so far. She is so nice and will help you after class if you need it. TAKE HER!!

Professor McAleer is an amazing professor and if you have the chance, take her class! She really wants you to understand what shes teaching and teaches the material well. If you care about school, take her class and she will take care of you.

She is a caring professor and will stay after class to help you if you need it. Since half of my class was online, we had to do ALEKS, which was pretty time consuming but doable. DO THE STUDY GUIDES, she gives you bonus points if you do them on the tests and she selects half the questions to put on the test as well. It's not hard if you try.

She's super sweet and is always willing to help students who need extra help. She gives great video resources and is willing to stay a bit after hours to help you work out problems. The homework is ALEKS and you should expect to spend 5 hours or more each week completing it. She offers a textbook online, but you honestly don't need it.

I wish I could take her for every math class. She cares about us becoming amazing math teachers and it shows. I loved her teaching style. She is available for extra help. The class environment is very supportive. I learned sooooo much in this class!!!! You will apply this information into the classroom.
She was helpful when my phone broke and couldn't access D2l

This is an elementary school math class, so it can't really be tough, but she taught it really well. The exercises given in class and taken from the book were very helpful. She gives you a few homework and quizzes occasionally, but they are quite easy. She is very easy to follow and if you pay attention, you should get an A no problem.

I would definitely take Professor McAleer's class again. She made class time enjoyable and go by quickly. The material wasn't too difficult but for the parts that were she was intentional in spending more time so that we would understand. I loved her class and her teaching style. She cared about us becoming great teachers one day.

She is an amazing professor that I'm so glad to have had for this course. She made the lectures interesting and enjoyable, and I would 100% take her again if I could. She really cares about her students and wants everyone to succeed, and you can tell she is excited about helping prepare future teachers.

She really cares about her students and wants to help. I'm not the best at math but she really makes it easy to understand. She gives multiple extra credit opportunities and is very accommodating. Take her!!!

Overall Professor McAleer is a good choice. She does care about her students and will work with you if you don't understand. I just found myself uninterested in the class so I wasn't a huge fan of it, but she was a good professor.

Dr. McAleer has been my favorite math professor at KSU. She made the class very simple. There was like 3 tests and a final which was cumulative. She never checked the HW but I suggest you practice with them. Her problem write ups were super fun. 10/10
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Clear grading criteria--Amazing lectures

comment: Great professer and super kind!

She was a very good teacher and really cared that you knew the material. If you do not come to class, you will be very confused, because a lot of the stuff we did builds on itself, and there are extra things that she goes through that aren't in the book.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.--Caring

comment: She's wonderful and so caring. I definitely would recommend her to anyone. Midterm and final, a few quizzes, and a few problem write ups. Content is not very hard, sometimes confusing. You need to go to class or you will be confused because everything builds on each other just like a normal math class. Its really cool to see math from a teacher POV
Professor McAleer is extremely kind and caring. She cares about her subject matter and goes out of her way to ensure students understand. I would take her again in a heartbeat!
